Denis1 - (13:11): sdumitriu: hi, on the logo round 2 page, there is no mention of the authors of each proposal, is it normal ?  
lucaa left at 13:11 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:11  
sdumitriu - (13:11): They're the same as the ones from the previous round  
sdumitriu - (13:12): The name is not that important at this stage  
Denis1 - (13:12): for sure  
sdumitriu - (13:12): People should vote for the logo  
Denis1 - (13:12): so it is intended, this was my only question  
sdumitriu - (13:12): But yes, each one will receive the proper credits and thanks at the end  
sdumitriu - (13:13): Thanks for checking, Denis  
Denis1 - (13:13): you are welcome :)  
Denis1 is now known as Denis ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)

gvallarelli joined #xwiki at 15:11  
gvallarelli - (15:11): hi  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:11): Hi gvallarelli.  
gvallarelli - (15:12): I've refined my proposal someone could give me some feedback especially about timeline and week by week plan? http://docs.google.com/Doc?docid=0AajwTC2Bps4GZGczcjJ2MndfNWs3OWpxa2Ny&hl=en  
glerouge - (15:13): I'm not quite sure how it's related to XWiki?  
gvallarelli - (15:14): glerouge, no it's not related to XWiki  
sdumitriu - (15:14): Guys, OK to start the second round for the logo challenge vote?  
glerouge - (15:16): +1 for the second round for me  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:19): I don't see why it should be held up. +1  
sdumitriu - (15:22): Held up because 19 wasn't updated  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:24): Well, you can see how uninformed my +1 is,  take it as such.  
jvdrean - (15:26): sdumitriu: I pinged the guys but they don't plan to update it  
sdumitriu - (15:28): jvdrean: OK, thanks  
tmortagne - (15:31): sdumitriu: is it normal i don't see images when looking at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/LogoChallengeRound2 page ?  
sdumitriu - (15:32): Yes, they are linked  
tmortagne - (15:32): ok  
sdumitriu - (15:32): I decided to do it this way because they were too many, and at different sizes  
sdumitriu - (15:32): People should look at each one with a fresh eye, and not all of them top to bottom at once  
tmortagne - (15:34): sure, it's just not obvious that you have to click in the links (especially since it was not that way in the fist round), maybe having a different colors for theses links or something if possible  
tmortagne - (15:36): or just puting something around like  
tmortagne - (15:36): < Fruit  salad palette >  
tmortagne - (15:36): or  
tmortagne - (15:36): [ Fruit  salad palette ]  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:37): Hahaha, great logo for the bug tracker: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Community/LogoChallengeRound2/finalanime.png  
gvallarelli - (15:41): so beautiful  
gvallarelli - (15:45): I love pencil's logo :)  
glerouge - (15:45): yes, the second version of the logos is cool  
vmassol - (15:45): agreed  
annacondan left at 15:45 (Quit: annacondan  
glerouge - (15:46): I think there's only 15 that I liked better before  
gvallarelli - (15:46): congrats to all designers

Ciprian left #xwiki at 16:29  
nickless joined #xwiki at 16:43  
anamarias - (16:47): hi  
anamarias - (16:47): I'm trying to use in a JSX object a value from a URL get parameter  
anamarias - (16:47): but the velocity variables are not available  
lucaa - (16:47): they're available for the Script page  
anamarias - (16:47): I have in my doc:  
anamarias - (16:47): #set($destdoc="$!{request.ddoc}")  
anamarias - (16:47): ##  
anamarias - (16:47): $xwiki.jsx.use('Macros.WebHome')  
anamarias - (16:47): and in JSX:  
anamarias - (16:48): document.observe('xwiki:dom:loaded', function(event) {  
anamarias - (16:48):   var bar = "${destdoc}";  
anamarias - (16:48):   var foo = "${request.ddoc}";  
anamarias - (16:48):   console.log('bar = ' + bar);  
lucaa - (16:48): anamarias: I know what you mean  
anamarias - (16:48): what can I do?  
anamarias - (16:48): console.log prints:  
anamarias - (16:48): bar = ${destdoc}  
anamarias - (16:48): foo = ${request.ddoc}  
lucaa - (16:48): because the request is the one fetching the script, the context of the velocity in the script is the one for the script fetch (xwiki/bin/jsx/Space/PageWithScript)  
anamarias - (16:49): oh I see, so 2 different contexts  
lucaa - (16:49): yes, it;s the one of the page evaluating  
lucaa - (16:49): and $xwiki.jsx.use  
anamarias - (16:49): then I don't understand  
plunden joined #xwiki at 16:49  
lucaa - (16:49): actually generates a script element in the header  
lucaa - (16:50): with the href /xwiki/bin/jsx/Space/PageWithJS  
lucaa - (16:50): and there is a separate call to get that js, so the context is different  
anamarias - (16:50): and how can I use that in my case/  
anamarias - (16:50): ?  
lucaa - (16:50): lemme think  
lucaa - (16:50): sdumitriu to the rescue...  
sdumitriu - (16:50): anamarias: Two options  
sdumitriu - (16:51): 1: forward the variables as script use parameters (as in $xwiki.jsx.use($doc.fullName, {'bar' : ${destdoc}, 'foo' : ${request.ddoc}})  
sdumitriu - (16:52): 2: Read the variables from somewhere in the HTML  
sdumitriu - (16:52): 1 is bad for caches, since the URL keeps changing each time  
sdumitriu - (16:52): But 2 might be harder to implement  
anamarias - (16:53): so I just put an html element with the value of the get parameter in it ?  
anamarias - (16:53): (I guess hidden)  
sdumitriu - (16:53): Yes  
sdumitriu - (16:53): You could use a hidden input  
anamarias - (16:53): so, what html element would be best suited for it  
sdumitriu - (16:54): <input type="hidden" id="destdoc" value="${destdoc}"/>  
florinciu left at 16:54 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sdumitriu - (16:54): ?i po?i s? iei cu $('destdoc').value  
anamarias - (16:54): and I don't have to put it in a form element or smth, right?  
sdumitriu - (16:54): No  
anamarias - (16:55): ok, cool  
anamarias - (16:55): thanks!  
sdumitriu - (16:55): Since you don't want it submitted, it's OK to put it anywhere  
sdumitriu - (16:55): You're welcome  
mariusbutuc joined #xwiki at 16:56  
mariusbutuc - (16:57): sdumitriu: so it's not mandatory for an input element to reside in a form element, right?  
sdumitriu - (16:57): Right  
mariusbutuc - (16:57): I see, thanks :)  
sdumitriu - (16:57): It's not the most correct practice when it comes to document semantics, but it is valid  
mariusbutuc - (16:58): well, if it's valid, it could have saved me some effort several times  
mariusbutuc - (16:59): good that it's clear now  
evalica left at 17:06 (Read error: Connection reset by peer

CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:13): Why does checkstyle disallow empty catch blocks?  
silviar left at 17:16 (Quit: Leaving.

anamarias left at 17:23 (Quit: anamarias  
jvdrean - (17:43): tmortagne: do you know what prevent global users/groups from being added to local groups ?  
tmortagne - (17:43): jvdrean: it's detailed on the issue  
tmortagne - (17:44): (and i commented in the code)  
tmortagne - (17:44): let me find it  
tmortagne - (17:45): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4566  
jvdrean - (17:47): thanks  
arkub left at 17:56 (Quit: Leaving  
evalica left at 17:57 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa - (17:58): mmh, there seems to be an issue with the class editor: collapsed fields with modifications are not saved. I added several fields and, after setting the values, I was collapsing them to be able to see the new one. I saved and only the last one added (the uncollapsed one) was saved. Is this a known issue?  
sdumitriu - (17:59): No  
sdumitriu - (18:00): Really shouldn't happen  
arkub joined #xwiki at 18:00  
lucaa - (18:00): I noticed on 2.1.1, maybe that's the reason?  
SvenDowideit left at 18:11 (Ping timeout: 246 seconds  
SvenDowideit joined #xwiki at 18:11  
florinciu left at 18:23 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
nickless left at 18:28 (Ping timeout: 246 seconds  
Enygma` left at 18:32 (Quit: Leaving.  
nickless joined #xwiki at 18:41  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:41): I'm trying to make SaveAndContinueAction conform to checkstyle but it has an empty catch block.  
sdumitriu - (18:41): Just put a comment  
sdumitriu - (18:42): // Nothing to see here, move along  
sdumitriu - (18:42): Kidding, write a meaningful explanation  
sdumitriu - (18:42): Like, why is the exception ignored  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:42): :) I didn't know a comment was enough. Thanks.  
glerouge - (18:42): CalebJamesDeLisl: in truth it shouldn't be enough, but that's life  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:43): Enough to satisfy checkstyle that is.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:44): Even if it is bad practice to have empty catch blocks, I think checkstyle conformance changes should not change behavior which any "correct" change would.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:46): It would be nice to know why the exception was ignored (for the comment.)  
sdumitriu - (18:47): Which one?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:47): If sending a redirect fails.  
sdumitriu - (18:47):         } catch (IOException ignored) {  
sdumitriu - (18:47):         }  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:47): IOException  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:47): yup.  
sdumitriu - (18:48): Back with an answer in 5 minutes  
vmassol - (18:49): glerouge: it's enough on purpose  
vmassol - (18:49): not doing anything in a catch/block happens and is valid but in that case you must explain why  
vmassol - (18:50): we have lots of historic code in xwiki that used to just do try/catch and not deal correctly with the caught exception or not explain aynthing….  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:51): We could just throw it in the context under something like "exception" or "error" or some other non-standard term ;)  
sdumitriu - (18:53): CalebJamesDeLisl: sendRedirect can fail if the response has been "committed", which means some content has been sent already, since the redirect is in a HTTP header, which must come before the content  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:54): Looks like that would never happen.  
sdumitriu - (18:54): So the IOException is declard  
sdumitriu - (18:54): But we know that this can't happen  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:55): Thanks.  
sdumitriu - (18:55): Btw, you're implementing XWIKI-5080?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:56): Yup.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:56): I like your idea as well, sometimes I forget about other ideas.  
sdumitriu - (18:56): Special case, if back contains "ajax", then return?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:56): Yes, same as SaveAction  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:57): No not if back contains ajax. If context.get("ajax") != 0  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:57): Copy-paste from SaveAction...  
mflorea left at 18:58 (Quit: Leaving.  
Ciprian joined #xwiki at 19:00  
sdumitriu - (19:01): Yes, good  
factor\_ joined #xwiki at 19:04  
factor left at 19:04 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
plunden left at 19:04 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
factor\_ left at 19:05 (Client Quit  
factor joined #xwiki at 19:05  
KermitTheFragger left at 19:06 (Quit: gone for food  
vmassol - (19:13): CalebJamesDeLisl: "Action used for saving and returning to to the edit page rather than viewing changes.". Double "to"  
vmassol - (19:16): nitpick: "@param url A url to get a modified version of." According to the javadoc best practice doc, "the" should be used (in lowercase) instead of "A"  
vmassol - (19:18): I hope you haven't introduced a regression (since it's for 2.3RC1) since there are no tests to prove it works as before (not your fault that there were no tests)  
vmassol - (19:19): it would be great to explain somewhere why some params are being stripped  
vmassol - (19:20): we should really try to use the xwiki-url URL parser, it would simplify all this  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:21): (Was getting tea...)  I am stripping params to try to maintain the same behavior.  
vmassol - (19:22): (I know that)  
vmassol - (19:22): but since you're adding doc to it  
vmassol - (19:22): might be good to understand why it's done  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:22): If I document why it was done, then I am documenting based on a guess.  
vmassol - (19:22): so you don't know either? :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:23): I don't know the author original intent.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:23): I also don't know where stripping those parameters would be useful so no, I don't know.  
sdumitriu - (19:24): tmortagne: You should replace all the systemouts from Puma with proper logs  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:35): Seems I did manage to sneak a regression in. Parameters were supposed to only be stripped from the referer.  
tmortagne - (19:37): sdumitriu: i know  
tmortagne - (19:38): it's just here to test with websphere  
tmortagne - (19:38): just waiting that all is working with it to put back LOG.debug  
tmortagne - (19:38): (it used to be LOG.debug already)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:39): This looks like a bug:  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:39): if (back != null && back.indexOf("editor=class") >= 0) {  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 19:39  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:40): Will never be true if back comes from the referer.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:43): I'm going add a comment that this is the behavior and leave it.  
vmassol - (19:48): CalebJamesDeLisl: you should maybe have added a test first  
vmassol - (19:48): verify it passes, then made the change  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:49): re the bug?  
vmassol - (19:49): re your changes  
vmassol - (19:49): since they're far from being trivial  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:50): I'm not sure what kind of a test would catch all possible problems (I know it's no excuse)  
vmassol - (19:50): errr?  
vmassol - (19:50): so you're saying tests are useless?  
vmassol - (19:51): you'r just introducing something very risk  
vmassol - (19:51): on a RC release  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:51): In this case I can't figure out how to test, all tests I can imagine would be unlikely to fail.  
vmassol - (19:55): jsut doing a similar modifucation somewhere else  
vmassol - (19:55): (much simpler than yours)  
vmassol - (19:56): and already found 2 bugs thanks to the test  
vmassol - (19:56): (I'm glad I added it)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:56): Are there any tests for actions?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:57): Ahh yes I see skin action test.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (19:58): Hmm, mock request objects...
